channel.title: Misc on Harvester manual test cases
channel.description: Recent content in Misc on Harvester manual test cases

item.title: Button of `Download KubeConfig` (e2e_fe)
item.description:
Ref: https://github.com/harvester/harvester/issues/1349

Verify Items

  • Download KubeConfig should not exist in general views
  • Download Kubeconfig should exist in Support page
  • Downloaded file should be named with suffix .yaml

Case: Download KubeConfig

  • navigate to every pages to make sure download kubeconfig icon will not appear in header section
  • navigate to support page to check Download KubeConfig is work normally

item.title: Check favicon and title on pages
item.description:
• Related issues: #1520 incorrect title and favicon

Verification Steps

  1. Log into Harvester
  2. Check page title and favicon on each of these pages
    • dashboard
    • main page
    • settings
    • support
    • Volumes
    • SSH Keys
    • Host info

Expected Results

  1. Harvester favicon and title should show on each page

item.title: Check Harvester CloudInit CRDs within Harvester, Terraform & Rancher
item.description:
• Related issues: #3902 support elemental cloud-init via harvester-node-manager

Testing With Terraform

  1. TBD

Testing From Harvester UI

  1. TBD

Testing From Rancher Fleet UI / Harvester Fleet Controller

  1. TBD

Testing w/ Harvester Kubeconfig via Kubectl & K9s (or similar tool)

Pre-Reqs:

  • Have an available multi-node Harvester cluster, w/out your ssh-key present on any nodes
  • Provision cluster however is easiest
  • K9s (or other similar kubectl tooling)
  • kubectl
  • audit elemental toolkit for an understanding of stages
  • audit harvester configuration to correlate properties to elemental-toolkit based stages / functions

Negative Tests:

Validate Non-YAML Files Get .yaml as Suffix On File-System

  1. Prepare a YAML loadout of a CloudInit resource that takes the shape of:
apiVersion: node.harvesterhci.io/v1beta1
kind: CloudInit
metadata:
  name: write-file-with-non-yaml-filename
spec:
  matchSelector: {}
  filename: 99_filewrite.log
  contents: |
    stages:
      fs:
        - name: "write file test"
          commands:
            - echo "hello, there" > /etc/sillyfile.conf

item.title: Create support bundle in multi-node Harvester cluster with one node off
item.description:
• Related issues: #1524 Can’t create support bundle if one node is off

Verification Steps

  1. On a multi-node harvester cluster power off one node
  2. Navigate to support create support bundle

Expected Results

  1. Support bundle should create and be downloaded
  2. YOu should be able to extract and examine support bundle

item.title: Download kubeconfig after shutting down harvester cluster
item.description:
• Related issues: #1475 After shutting down the cluster the kubeconfig becomes invalid

Category:

  • Host

Verification Steps

  1. Shutdown harvester node 3, wait for fully power off

  2. Shutdown harvester node 2, wait for fully power off

  3. Shutdown harvester node 1, wait for fully power off

  4. Wait for more than hours or over night

  5. Power on node 1 to console page until you see management url

item.title: Test NTP server timesync
item.description:
• Related issues: #1535 NTP daemon in host OS

Environment setup

This should be on at least a 3 node setup that has been running for several hours that had NTP servers setup during install

Verification Steps

  1. SSH into nodes and verify times are close
  2. Verify NTP is active with sudo timedatectl status

Expected Results

  1. Times should be within a minute of each other
  2. NTP should show as active

item.title: Verify network data template
item.description:
• Related issues: #1634 Welcome screen asks to agree to T&Cs for using Rancher not Harvester

Verification Steps

  1. Install Harvester
  2. Go to management page and see last line (before Continue button)
  3. Verify link to SUSE EULA https://www.suse.com/licensing/eula/

Expected Results

  1. Link should go to SUSE EULA
